commits.message:
EUCA-10705 - Eucanetd reverse DNS lookup can cause a flood of UDP/DNS traffic
    Description: The gni_populate() method in globalnetwork.c was performing a
    reverse IP dns lookup of every instance's node controller every 5 seconds.

    Changes:
     - globalnetwork.{h,c}:
     -- Added helper functions relating to allocation,searching,freeing of
        ip->hostname mapping
     -- Changed gni_populate() method signature to pass in pointer to the
        gni_hostname_info structure.
     -- Handles the use case when node controllers are added to the system.
     -- Uses basic qsort/bsearch methods to sort and search the mappings by ip.

     -eucanetd.c
     -- global host_info variable to hold the ip->hostname mappings.

     -cluster/handlers.c
     -- The network config is parsed then stored in shared memory, because of this
        the host_info structure isn't populated once, but populated each time the
        network config is parsed (every 5 seconds). This won't remove all lookups
        but will only perform N lookups where N is the number of node controllers.

    Testing:
     - Tested with customer's xml files by instrumenting eucanetd.
     - Also modified customer's xml files to simulate addition of nc to the config
     -- by adding one ip
     -- by changing *all* ips of the ncs in the config

Fix issue discovered by Coverity for EUCA-10705
 - properly free host_info and gni memory.
